title: Creating a reading list of articles on unsupervised parsing in natural language processing (NLP) involves selecting influential and relevant papers that have contributed to the field. Here is a list of 20 articles up to 2021
note: that focus on unsupervised approaches and their applications in parsing:

title: A Generative Constituent-Context Model for Improved Grammar Induction
container-title: *Proceedings of the 40th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL)*

title: Corpus-Based Induction of Syntactic Structure: Models of Dependency and Constituency
container-title: *Proceedings of the 42nd Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL)*

title: Shared Logistic Normal Distributions for Soft Parameter Tying in Unsupervised Grammar Induction
container-title: *Human Language Technologies: The 2009 Annual Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics (NAACL)*

title: Simple Robust Grammar Induction with Combinatory Categorial Grammars
container-title: *Proceedings of the 26th Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI)*

title: Breaking Out of Local Optima with Count Transforms and Model Recombination: A Study in Grammar Induction
container-title: *Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP)*

title: Sparsity in Dependency Grammar Induction
container-title: *Proceedings of the 48th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL)*

title: Improving Unsupervised Dependency Parsing with Richer Contexts and Smoothing
container-title: *Human Language Technologies: The 2009 Annual Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics (NAACL)*

title: Unsupervised Induction of Tree Substitution Grammars for Dependency Parsing
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2010 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP)*

title: Smatch: An Evaluation Metric for Semantic Feature Structures
container-title: *Proceedings of the 51st Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL)*

title: Dependency Grammar Induction with a Part-of-Speech Mixture Model
container-title: *Proceedings of the 23rd International Conference on Computational Linguistics (COLING)*

title: Using Universal Linguistic Knowledge to Guide Grammar Induction
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2010 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP)*

title: Fast Unsupervised Incremental Parsing
container-title: *Proceedings of the 45th Annual Meeting of the Association of Computational Linguistics (ACL)*

title: Simple Unsupervised Grammar Induction from Raw Text with Cascaded Finite State Models
container-title: *Proceedings of the 49th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL)*

title: Low-Cost and Effective Active Learning for Dependency Parsing
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2019 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP)*

title: Optimality Theory Parsing as Alignment
container-title: *Proceedings of the 57th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL)*

title: Unsupervised Dependency Parsing with Recursive Neural Networks
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2015 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP)*

title: Ordered Neurons: Integrating Tree Structures into Recurrent Neural Networks
container-title: *Proceedings of the 6th International Conference on Learning Representations (ICLR)*

title: Unsupervised Latent Tree Induction with Deep Inside-Outside Recursive Autoencoders
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2019 Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics (NAACL)*

title: Unsupervised Parsing via Constituency Tests
container-title: *Proceedings of the 58th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL)*

title: Fast and Accurate Shift-Reduce Constituent Parsing
container-title: *Proceedings of the 58th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL)*

title: These articles cover a range of topics within unsupervised parsing, including grammar induction, dependency parsing, and the use of neural networks. They provide a solid foundation for understanding the development and application of unsupervised methods in NLP parsing
